text: William Knowlton Zinsser (October 7, 1922 - May 12, 2015) was an American writer, editor, literary critic, and teacher. He began his career as a journalist for the New York Herald Tribune, where he worked as a feature writer, drama editor, film critic, and editorial writer. He was known for writing the book On Writing Well. Zinsser was born in New York City, New York. He studied at Deerfield Academy. Zinsser died in New York City at the age of 92. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1922 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American literary critics Category:American movie critics Category:Educators from New York City Category:American journalists Category:Writers from New York City
title: William Zinsser
